title.narrative: OUTPUT 2 [QUALITY EDUCATION]

description.narrative: By the end of 2019, 2,000 school structures (CDPE, F1 and F2) in the regions of Mali have tools, and skills to implement and monitor the learning competences of girls and boys - including the most marginalized and those living with a disability - from 3 to 15 years., which contributes to Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: [Equitable Access to Quality Basic Education]: By the end of 2019, the barriers to school attendance for children aged 3â€“15, particularly girls and the most disadvantaged children, have been lifted and children are able to access quality basic education and succeed at school.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2019, 2,000 school structures (CDPE, F1 and F2) in the regions of Mali have tools, and skills to implement andmonitor the learning competences of girls and boys - including the most marginalized and those living with a disability - from 3 to15 years.

description.narrative: UNICEF improved the service delivery to 918 schools through strengthening decentralized school management and oversight. In 2019, 115,095 children benefitted from learning kits (74 per cent of the annual target). In support for crisis-affected children, 29,564 out of a target of 50,000 crisis-affected girls and boys were educated in a classroom where the teacher has been trained in Psychosocial Support (59 per cent of the target). In 2019, the training and monitoring of 918 School Management Committees (SMCs) and the implementation of school action plans was a key achievement (123 per cent of target) | Status:Met | As-of Date:06/02/2020
